VERMONT AGENCY OF AGRICULTURE, FOOD AND MARKETS' 2021 FSMIP APPLICATION, MARKET DEVELOPMENT THROUGH BUSINESS EDUCATION, TAKES A FOCUSED APPROACH TO DEVELOPING MARKET CHANNEL SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT VALUE-ADDED AGRICULTURAL BUSINESSES. WITH A STRONG

THIS PROPOSAL HAS A GOAL TO SUPPORT THE TRANSITION FROM METHYL BROMIDE (MB) FUMIGATION TO NON-CHEMICAL PHYTOSANITARY TREATMENT METHODS FOR THE TREATMENT OF EXPORT LOGS (VALUE OF 1.2 BILLION IN 2020) AND OTHER AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS. OVER THE LAST 10 YERAS, THE US HAS STARTED TO FOCUS ON THE GRADUAL ELIMINATION OF OZONE-DEPLETING CHEMICALS LIKE MB FOR PHYTOSANITARY TREATMENT. TODAY, THE SOLUTION HAS BEEN BROUGHT TO THE MARKET AND IS AVAILABLE FOR COMMERCIAL USE. HOWEVER, THE COST OF THE NEW TECHNOLOGY HAS BECOME A BARRIER FOR EXPORT LOG INDUSTRIES. IN ADDITION, IT IS UNKNOWN IF CURRENT EXPORT LOG MARKETS WOULD ACCEPT THIS NEW TREATMENT METHOD. THE RESEARCH TEAM PROPOSES CONDUCTING A STUDY TO IDENTIFY THE MOST FEASIBLE LOCATION FOR A VACUUM AND STEAM TREATMENT FACILITY IN VA. THIS LOCATION WILL ALSO SERVE WV, PA, MD, NC AND SC. THE TEAM WILL VISIT LOG IMPORTERS AND PHYTOSANITARY AUTHORITIES IN CHINA AND JAPAN TO CAPTURE BARRIERS AND DRIVERS OF THIS NEW TECHNOLOGY FROM THEIR PERSPECTIVE. THESE COUNTRIES REPRESENT 86% OF THE US EXPORT LOG MARKET. THE OUTPUTS OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HIGHLY BENEFICIAL NOT ONLY TO THE EXPORT LOG INDUSTRY BUT TO OTHER AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES THAT CAN BE TREATED USING STEAM AND VACUUM SUCH AS FRUITS, VEGETABLES, COTTON, RICE, STRAW, AND SEEDS. IN ADDITION, USING ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY TREATMENT TECHNOLOGIES WOULD HELP GAIN MARKET PENETRATION IN ALTERNATIVE MARKETS SUCH AS THE EUROPEAN UNION.

THIS PROJECT WILL EVALUATE CONSUMER PREFERENCES AND PRODUCER BENEFITS FROM SELLING PECAN PRODUCTS WITH VARHYING HEALTH-AND TASTE-RELATED NFORMATION, WHICH WILL ALLOW IDENTIFYING MARKETING PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS WITH POTENTIAL FOR INCREASING PECAN SALES. SCIENTIFIC EVIDENCE ON THE HEALTH-PROMOTING PROPERTIES OF PECANS CAN BE USED AS A POWERFUL MARKETING TOOL TO REACH POTENTIAL MARKETS THAT ARE DRIVEN BY HEALTH AWARENESS. THESE MARKETS HAVE BEEN THE BASIS FOR THE EXTRAORDINARY GROWTH IN SALES OF SPECIALTY CROPS IN RECENT YEARS. BECAUSE HEALTH CLAIMS CAN INFLUCENCE PERCEIVED HEALTH AND TASTE, BOTH HEALTH AND TASTE ATTRIBUTES OF PECANS WILL BE SIMULTANEOUSLY EVALUATED IN THIS STUDY. THE STUDY HAS THREE STAGES. FIRST, WE WILL COMPILE AND DEVELOP MARKETING MESSAGES -- VARYING IN HEALTH AND TASTE-RELATED INFORMATION AND IN COLLABORATION WITH PECAN PRODUCERS, THE TPB AND THE APC. SECOND, WE WILL GENERATE EXPERIEMENTAL EVIDENCE FROM ECONOMIC EXPERIMENTS WITH PRODUCERS AND AN ONLINE EXPERIMENT WITH CONSUMERS USING A NON-HYPOTHETICAL AUCTION-LIKE MECHANISN. THIRD, FINDINGS FROM THE SECOND STAGE WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP AND TEST MARKETING PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS CURRENTLY BEING CONSIDERED BY THE PECAN INDUSTRY AT DIFFERENT PECAN RETAILERS IN ORDER TO EVALUATE THE EFFECT OF DEVELOPED PROMOTIONAL INFORMATION ON ACTUAL SALES. THE CONCLUSIONS OF THIS STUDY CAN BE USED TO ENHANCE THE ALREADY SUCCESSFUL PROGRAMS DEVELOPED BY THE PECAN INDUSTRY FOR MARKETING MESSAGES TO INCREASE SALES. THE OUTCOME AND EXPERIENCE OF THIS ACADEMIC-PRIVATE INDUSTRY PARTNERSHIP WILL SERVE AS A BASIS TO DEVELOP A SYSTEMATIC MARKETING STRATEGY THAT CAN INFORM PRODUCERS/RETAILERS OF OTHER SPECIALITY CROPS ABOUT HOW TO POTENTIALLY IMPROVE SALES.

PICK TENNESSEE PRODUCTS (PTP) PROGRAM PROMOTIONS COMMUNICATE WHICH PRODUCTS ARE PRODUCED IN-STATE TO END CONSUMERS. THIS PROJECT'S GOAL IS TO HELP ADD VALUE TO TENNESSEE'S AGRICULTURE AND FORESTRY INDUSTRIES BY PROVIDING INFORMATION TO AID IN EFFECTIVE PROMOTION OF THE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE'S (TDA) PTP PROGRAM. OBJECTIVES TO ADDRESS THIS OVERALL PROJECT GOAL ARE: 1) DEVELOP MARKET PROFILES OF PTP CORE CUSTOMERS BASED ON DEMOGRAPHICS, PERCEPTIONS, AND MOTIVATIONS; 2) ESTIMATE WILLINGNESS-TO-PAY (WTP) FOR PTP IN KEY PRODUCT CATEGORIES USING EXAMPLE PRODUCTS; 3) PROVIDE ASSESSMENT OF EFFECTIVENESS OF VARIOUS MARKETING CHANNELS IN REACHING THE CORE CUSTOMERS, BUILDING BRAND AWARENESS, AND GENERATING VALUE FOR TENNESSEE PRODUCERS; AND 4) DISSEMINATE RESULTS BY PROVIDING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION MATERIALS TO TENNESSEE PRODUCERS ABOUT OPPORTUNITIES RELATED TO PARTICIPATION IN THE PTP PROGRAM AND VALUE IT COULD ADD TO THEIR PRODUCTS BASED ON CONSUMER RESEARCH. AN ONLINE CONSUMER CHOICE SURVEY WILL ASSESS TENNESSEE CONSUMERS' AWARENESS OF PTP AND WTP FOR PTP IN SEVERAL KEY PRODUCT CATEGORIES. IN ADDITION, AN EYE-TRACKING STUDY WILL EVALUATE HOW DIFFERENT PROMOTION CONTENT IMPACTS CONSUMER PREFERENCES FOR PRODUCTS IN THE PTP PROGRAM. RESULTS WILL AID IN DEVELOPING A DIGITAL MARKETING CAMPAIGN WHICH WILL BE LAUNCHED DURING THE STUDY AND CONSUMER ONLINE TRAFFIC WILL BE MEASURED. A SECOND POST-CAMPAIGN SURVEY WILL PROVIDE MEASURES OF CAMPAIGN AWARENESS, PTP AWARENESS, AND WTP. RESULTS WILL AID FUTURE MARKETING EFFORTS RELATED TO THE PTP PROGRAM BY IDENTIFYING CORE CONSUMER DEMOGRAPHICS AND PERCEPTIONS ALLOWING FOR BETTER TARGET MARKETING STRATEGIES TO THESE CUSTOMERS.

EMPHASIS ON RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES PRESENTS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO REVITALIZE THE SHEEP SECTOR. GRAZING SHEEP UNDER SOLAR ARRAYS, AS A MEANS TO CONTROL VEGETATIVE GROWTH, WILL INCREASE FARM INCOME DERIVED BY PROVIDING GRAZING SERVICES AND DRIVE A NEED FOR MORE SHEEP. SUCH AN INCREASE IN SUPPLY CALLS FOR ADDITIONAL PLAYERS IN THE MARKET PLACE AND THE NEED TO EXPLORE POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIFFERENTIATED SOLAR-GRAZED LAMB PRODUCTS. THE GOAL OF THE NEW DAWN PROJECT IS THAT COOPERATIVE OR MULTI-PRODUCER OWNED ORGANIZATIONS ARE FORMED TO PROVIDE GRAZING COORDINATION, LOGISTICS, AND MARKETING SERVICES ON BEHALF OF SHEEP FARMERS. OUTCOMES TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF NEED THROUGH ONLINE SURVEYS, FOCUS GROUPS, AND INTERVIEWS, AND DEVELOPMENT OF FINANCIAL FEASIBILITY TEMPLATES AND A USERS' GUIDE FOR ECONOMIC ANALYSIS OF ALTERNATIVE BUSINESS SCENARIOS. FURTHER, THE PROJECT WILL INVESTIGATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR MARKET EXPANSION FOR LAMB AND SHEEP FROM SOLAR-GRAZED AND CONVENTIONAL PASTURES INCLUDING VALUE-ADDED, PRODUCT DIFFERENTIATION OF SOLAR-GRAZED LAMB. A RESOURCE REPORT WILL BE CREATED AND SHARED WITH SHEEP FARMERS, INDUSTRY TRADE GROUPS, AND LAND GRANT EXTENSION EDUCATORS THROUGH REGIONAL AND VIRTUAL MEETINGS AND POSTED ONLINE. THE FEASIBILITY ANALYSIS TEMPLATES AND GUIDE WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE AS A TOOL FOR FARMERS OR EDUCATORS TO PURSUE THE FORMATION OF A COOPERATIVE BUSINESS. A CASE STUDY WILL IDENTIFY BEST PRACTICES FOR PROFESSIONAL STAFF TO UNDERTAKE WHEN CONDUCTING EFFORTS SIMILAR TO THE NEW DAWN PROJECT. THE CASE STUDY WILL INCLUDE BEST PRACTICES AND PITFALLS TO AVOID WHEN FORMING A COOPERATIVE OR OTHER MULTI-PRODUCER OWNED ORGANIZATION.
